instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.PP0V9_SSD_REG: What is PP0V9_SSD_REG? PP0V9_SSD_REG is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD inside newer Macbooks. This must be present for the machineâ€™s SSD to work. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
Hi, new here!

Got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board that had minor liquid spill by the display connector on the screen side, as well as around BIOS chip.
After a new display cable and touch-up of suspicious components, the symptoms are as follows:
- No internal display with known good screen, external display works
- Draws 20v 350-600mA
- Takes nearly two minutes to boot up the screen and then another minute to display folder icon
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND</SIGNAL> = 0v
- <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_IUVD</SIGNAL> = 0v
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> = 0v
- <SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> = 0v
- No obvious corrosion left on the motherboard nor probe points
- Nothing flaring up on thermal camera

Do these symptoms sound familiar and what would be the next logical area to test?

Thanks for your assistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Folder icon displayed means SSD is not detected; normal, as no voltage on it.
Missing image on internal LCD is very likely bad CPU eDP output.
Is a classic fault after liquid spill on video connectors.

Post diode mode to ground on SSD power rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
Can eDP signals be measured with no screen attached? And what should I measure against?

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> - 0.6
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_FIXED</SIGNAL> - 0.9
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> - 0.9
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> - 1.1
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_REG</SIGNAL> - 0.15

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
You can check diode mode to ground on data lines; w/ and w/o LCD connected (no power, of course)
But voltages will require LCD detection to be maintained.

As you also have missing SSD voltages, the problem is not only about video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75723, member: 682"]
You can check diode mode to ground on data lines; w/ and w/o LCD connected (no power, of course)
[/QUOTE]
What voltages should I expect on the probe points?

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75723, member: 682"]
As you also have missing SSD voltages, the problem is not only about video.
[/QUOTE]
I am aware these are two different problems. Do the diode readings give any hints at what to measure next?
Any reason to suspect <CHIP>U8600</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
You can only check for voltages at J8500 in the first few seconds, if the screen is not connected.
After that, PCH will disable the voltages; because <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> stays low.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message: Do my SSD rails' diode readings give any hints at what to measure next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
J9600 looks clean.

Just noticed that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> is at 0.76v.
Does that point to <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> Piccolo chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75847, member: 682"]
Check J9600 connector.
[/QUOTE]
Does the cap need to be present for it to function/enable power to the SSD? I believe someone before me has removed it. The connector itself looks intact

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message: That cap is the heart of the Lifeboat connector!.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
That's great!.

With the cap on, all these voltages are on point for the first 2 minutes before the screen boots up:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_FIXED</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD_REG</SIGNAL>

However once the folder icon appears, they all drop to 0v.

What could that indicate?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message: Try to boot USB macOS and check what appears in Disk Utility.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-macbook-pro-touch-bar-question-mark-folder.60375/#post-68248[/URL]
I'm getting the same issue of non-responsive keyboard as mccafe had. 
Cannot perform resets nor hold Alt for boot selection.
USB key doesn't flash not even once during boot, nor when the folder icon appears

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD issue and no internal display
threads.message:
If someone else messed up with the board before you, rhis can be a nightmare.
Some technicians intentionally rip off components, or make damage on the boards; when they cannot fixed them.
